oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An ijāzah issued by Aḥmad Ḍiyāʼ al-Dīn ibn al-Ḥājj ʻAbd al-Raḥmān-zādah Muṣṭafá to ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Maḥmūd al-Rifqī (?) for Qaṣīdat al-Burdah of al-Būṣīrī. Includes a Turkish section which explains how the Qaṣīdah should be read and for what purposes.
Written in vocalized naskh, 15 lines per page, with catchwords. Text is framed within a golden line.
Bound. Purple paper over boards. Red leather over spine and corners.
Seal of Aḥmad Ḍiyāʼ al-Dīn on fol. 5v.
Written in the year 1300 AH [1882 or 3 AD], most probably in Turkey.
MS Arab 406. Houghton Library, Harvard University.
